question: The Trans-Siberian Railway (8960 km) connects which of the following cities?
explanation: The Trans-Siberian Railway is the longest railway in the world. It was built between 1891 and 1916 to connect Moscow to Irkutsk. En route it passes through the cities of Perm, Yekaterinburg, Omsk, Novosibirsk, Krasnoyarsk, Chita and Khabarovsk.
